repnme.cdata!: Korea - Science and Technical Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project was highly
            satisfactory, and likewise its sustainability. The lessons
            reinforce once again, that simple project design, and
            careful assessment of the implementation agencies at the
            earliest stages, facilitates project success. It is further
            stated that institutional capacity enhances implementation,
            as shown by the borrower's procurement agency, whose
            knowledge of the Bank's procurement procedures greatly
            benefited implementation. The diffusion of project
            equipment, made available to outside institutions,
            universities, private organizations, and industries,
            resulted in high equipment utilization rates, thus
            generating impressive numbers of research works, and
            publications, as well as supplemental income for future
            operation and maintenance funds of equipment.

18218316.theme: Environmental policies and institutions,Education for the knowledge economy
18218316.trustfund:
TF036673-SOUTH EAST ASIA REGION -
            EDUCATION PROJECTS (VIETNAM AND CAMBODIA)
18218316.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Human development

repnme.cdata!: Korea - Science and Technical Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the project is
            to assist in improving science and technical education and
            research through implementation of an agreed policies and
            action program and the provision of specialized equipment.
            Specifically the project will: (a) support quality
            improvement in undergraduate science and engineering
            departments in selected universities; (b) assist in
            strengthening the teaching and research capacity of marine
            science institutions to address environmental problems; (c)
            assist in improving the quality of practical science and
            engineering programs in the open universities and in
            selected junior technical colleges; (d) improve
            opportunities for joint research activities in basic
            sciences through strengthening common research facilities at
            the Korea Basic Science Center (KBSC); and (e) enhance the
            quality of training in selected vocational high schools. The
            project will also include specialized equipment and civil
            works for the construction of additional laboratories for KBSC.
